text: hi it's Angela today I'm using my
great-grandmother's tea cups and my
grandfather's tea set to show you how to
brew tea the old-fashioned way
think of it as relaxing moments with tea
now growing up I loved watching my
grandfather routine she would always let
me sit next to him and I would get my
own little mini tea cup but the best
thing about tea time was it was always
paired with some sort of Asian desserts
or sweets and today is no exception as
I'm pairing this with some matcha tea
cookies from Japan so sit back relax and
enjoy as I show you how to do some
ghulam tea eel fashioned way first get
out your tea set the white porcelain pot
and the cups that I have come in a set
but I'm going to use a clay teapot my
grandpa gave me I like using the clay
teapot because the more you use it the
more of the tea's flavors it absorbs
after many years of use you can just add
hot water and it'll still have the
fragrance and taste of tea which is kind
of neat next get out your tea leaves I'm
using three teaspoons of an oolong tea
from taiwan oolong teas are partially
fermented and are great to use with clay
teapots like this
start by adding hot water to the teapot
just on a boiling temperature swirl it
around a bit
then pour out the water into a serving
picture we're not actually going to
drink this first batch it's more for
cleaning the tea ware and warming the
serving cups so go ahead and pour the
water over the teapot then add the cups
to gently rinse and heat up the cup
temperature after you're done add more
hot water to the teapot for your first
group through for about one minute then
transfer to a serving pitcher now you
may be wondering why you need a serving
pitcher and why not just pour directly
into the cups well it's because the
flavors of the first bit of tea coming
out and the very last drops of the tea
will taste different a serving pitcher
allows for the flavors of the tea to
even out
you can keep receiving the tea leaves up
to four to six times after each steeping
just extend your brew time by another
twenty to thirty seconds don't forget to
enjoy this relaxing break by sipping
your tea slowly and pairing it with your
tea cookies and if you guys see these
matcha cookies at your grocery store
make sure to buy yourself a box they're
super yummy now when you're done brewing
the tea you can remove the leaves with a
bamboo tea remover and discard the
leaves or you can keep the leaves as a
fridge deodorizer just let them cool in
a small dish and put it in your fridge
while they are still slightly down
they'll observe any yucky fridge odors
if you have any including fish as the
last step you can rinse your teapot with
water if you'd like just don't use soap
here then with the tea towel gently rub
your pot to polish it and make it glow
over time the more you do this the
shinier your clay teapot will become and
finally set the teapot facedown and let
it air dry
thanks for joining this mini teen cookie
break with me
I hope media inspired you to go look for
some hand-me-down tea sets and medium
brew some tea
at home this weekend don't forget to
like this video and subscribe to my
channel angel mom's kitchen for more
authentic Asian recipes it's made simple
and fun so I'll see you guys in my next
video bye
